problem_text:
According to P. Hall, a group G is said to be homogeneous if every isomorphism of its finitely generated subgroups is induced by an automorphism of G. It is known (Higman–Neumann–Neumann) that every group is embeddable into a homogeneous one. Is the same true for the category of representations of groups?
A representation (V, G) is finitely generated if G is a finitely generated group, and V a finitely generated module over the group algebra of G.
B. I. Plotkin
